intro: Peucedanum galbanum var. dentatum, commonly known as the toothed angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its hollow stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, often toothed margin. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its roots are aromatic and contain compounds such as galbanum, which contribute to its medicinal and aromatic properties. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
